title: Woman who 'abducted girl from playground' gets second kidnapping charge for 'snatching two-year-old'
text:
A North Carolina woman charged with kidnapping a three-year-old girl has now now accused of kidnapping another toddler on the same day.

N'denezsia Lancaster, 22, of Greensboro, has been charged with the second-degree kidnapping of Zakiyah Woodard in addition to prior first-degree kidnapping charge.

She's accused of snatching three-year-old Ahlora Lindiment from an apartment merry-go-round last week. The girl was found safe the next day.

But prosecutors say Lancaster previously took two-year-old girl Woodward from the same spot and returned her safely, ABC 11 reports.

Scroll down for videos

The Greensboro Police Department accused 22-year-old N'denezsia Monique Lancaster (right) of kidnapping two children from a playground last week, one is Ahlora Ashanti Sample Lindement (left)

She is also charged with snatching Zakiyah Woodard and was booked on $50,000 bail for that. The woman appeared in court via video and an attorney said she suffers from bipolar and did not know what she was doing

The Greensboro Police Department had released a still from community security footage that showed the woman believed to have taken three-year-old Lindement on Wednesday night

The return of Woodward without injury of sexual harm determined the second-degree nature of the charge.

The mother of the girl told WFMY that the two-year-old was safe. The parent did not want to be identified or appear on camera.

A judge refused to lower Lancaster's $1million bond Monday. She was given a $50,000 secured bond for the case of Woodard.

Lancaster's attorney, Daniel Harris, says Lancaster has bipolar disorder and didn't know what she was doing in the incidents. She appeared in court via video.

He requested a mental evaluation and one was set for this week.

Lancaster may appear in court November 14.

The police chief shared that Ahlora has been reunited with her family, who are filled with 'jubilation' at her return

The department provided additional stills of the woman they identified as a suspect in the abduction

Ahlora's stepmom - Shatana Wallace - shared a video of the little girl in the hospital

She's also charged with assault in another case in which she's accused of attacking a man with a box cutter.

Meanwhile the 911 call regarding Lindiment's abduction has been shared.

In the call an operator is heard asking: 'Honey honey, pull it together. Who was with her at the park?'

The caller responds: 'Her big sister and her big brother. I don't know how they let somebody walk out with her.

'My niece and the kids were out here playing and my niece let somebody take my other niece. I don't know where she's at. I don't know what's going on.'

In another clip the operator asks: 'Did you see anybody with her?'

'I did see a big woman with her that's who took her,' another female responder says.

In an interview, the girl's mother - Erica Lindiment - expressed her hope that someone would come forward with information about her daughter's whereabouts

The Greensboro Police Department said that Ahlora Ashanti Sample Lindiment was abducted from a playground at 2411 Phillips Avenue at around 6.30pm

Lindiment was found wondering alone at a church 30 hours after she vanished.

The Greensboro Police Department Police launched a hunt to find her hours after Lindiment's stepmother - Shatana Wallace - shared a video of the little girl in the hospital.

Wallace thanked law enforcement and the community for their help in locating the child.

Another video posted by Ahlora's older sister - Toni Blackburn - provided more details about the abduction.

Another video posted by Ahlora's older sister - Toni Blackburn - criticized those who accused the girl's birth mother of abducting her

Blackburn went on an extended rant condemning people for suggesting that Ahlora's birth mom or any other family member had anything to do with the girl's disappearance.

She also asked for more information pertaining to Lancaster's whereabouts, blasting a man who she claimed helped pick Lancaster up from a bus stop.

Greensboro Police Chief Wayne Scott explained that the toddler was found wandering alone near the church. A woman found her and called the tipline for police.

Scott said that the toddler knew her mother's name, leading them to positively identify her.

She was transported to a local hospital and is said to be in 'relatively good shape.'

'She seems to be doing well as a three year old,' Scott added.

'The parents had been on edge for multiple hours,' he stated.

The Greensboro Police Department released a still from community security footage that showed the woman believed to have taken the girl.

Chief Scott explained that the woman had been seen at the playground from 3pm until 5pm Wednesday.

He said that the woman had been speaking with parents in the area but was spending most of her time interacting with children and was said to have been 'acting very suspicious.'

Ahlora was seen leaving the scene with the woman and the person 'overseeing' her called 911 once realizing she was missing, the police chief added.

The Greensboro Police Department said Lindiment was reported abducted from a playground at 2411 Phillips Avenue at approximately 6.30pm.

The Greensboro Police Department is asking for anyone with information to call the department at (336) 373-2287.

The Greensboro Police Department shared late Thursday night that Ahlora Ashanti Sample Lindement was found at the Words of Faith Christian Center at 719 Dillard Street at 8.18pm
description: N'denezsia Lancaster is now charged with second-degree kidnapping of Zakiyah Woodard in addition to first-degree kidnapping of Ahlora Lindiment in North Carolina last week.
